_description: ‘Stabat mater dolorosa’ — twenty-one quatrains, all stanzas but the first begin with ‘"O’

BodAsh59.First Lines:
HEyle goddes moder dolorousBy þe crosse stonding
                    forweppedWhile þy sone hong ful pitousþe swerd of sorowe
                    þyne hert kitte…
BodAsh59.Last Lines:
…þowe helpe me in þat stronge stourWhane þey
                    frome hens wolde me take
BodAsh59.Attributed Title:
Here nowe filoweþe nexst a devoute Invocacoun to oure Ladye with
                    þe [þe] refrayde Sabat mater dolorosa (f. 64); A dolorous Invcacoun
                    til oure ladye by the Priour of Bridlington (RT)
BodAsh59.Editions:
Brunner,  Karl. 
             “Kirchenleider aus dem 15. Jahrhundert.” 
             Anglia
         61 (1937): 13-51: 142-4.
Brown,  Carleton Fairchild,
                        ed.  
             Religious Lyrics of the XVth Century.
         Oxford: Clarendon, 1939: 22-5.
